options.name: name
options.description: The name of this configuration.

options.name: input
options.description: Input files or directories (directories are required for source mode).

options.name: target
options.description: The target server/technology/framework to migrate to. This could include multiple items (eg, "eap7" and "cloud-readiness").

options.name: userRulesDirectory
options.description: User Rules Directory (Search pattern: *.windup.groovy, *.windup.xml, *.mta.groovy and *.mta.xml).

options.name: source
options.description: The source server/technology/framework to migrate from. This could include multiple items (eg, "eap" and "spring").

options.name: skipReports
options.description: If set, MTA will not generate reports.

options.name: sourceMode
options.description: Indicates whether the input is source code or compiled binaries (Default: Compiled).

options.name: userIgnorePath
options.description: A path to the list of path patterns to skip during execution. If it points to a directory, all contained files named '*mta-ignore.txt' or '*windup-ignore.txt' will be considered as such list.

options.name: overwrite
options.description: Force overwrite of the output directory, without prompting.

options.name: excludePackages
options.description: A list of java package name prefixes to exclude (eg, com.myapp.subpackage).

options.name: mavenizeGroupId
options.description: Used in conjunction with the `mavenize` option. All pom.xml files will use this value as their <groupId>. If the parameter is omitted, MTA tries to guess some value based on the application, but this guess may be wrong. Last resort default value is 'com.mycompany.mavenized'.

options.name: exportCSV
options.description: Indicates whether to export CSV file containing the migration information.

options.name: excludeTags
options.description: Indicates the tags to exclude from processing. If this is unset, then all tags will be processed. If this is set, then Rules with the specified tags will be skipped.

options.name: packages
options.description: A list of java package name prefixes to scan (eg, com.myapp).

options.name: additionalClasspath
options.description: Adds additional files or directories to the classpath

options.name: disableTattletale
options.description: If set, a Tattletale report won't be generated.

options.name: enableCompatibleFilesReport
options.description: If set, MTA will generate a report of 'Compatible Files'. Keep in mind that generating this report may take a long time for large applications.

options.name: includeTags
options.description: Indicates the tags to process. If this is unset, then all tags will be processed. If this is set, then only Rules with the specified tags will be processed.

options.name: online
options.description: Indicates that network access is allowed. By turning it on, XML schemas can be validated against external resources, however, this comes with a performance penalty.

options.name: enableClassNotFoundAnalysis
options.description: Enable analysis of Java files that are not available on the Classpath. This should be left off if some classes will be unavailable at analysis time.

options.name: enableTattletale
options.description: If set, a Tattletale report will be generated for each application.

options.name: explodedApp
options.description: If the input path points to a directory, it should be treated as an unzipped application, instead of a directory containing applications (default).

options.name: keepWorkDirs
options.description: If set, MTA will not delete the temporary working files, like graph database and unzipped archives. Debugging purposes.

options.name: mavenize
options.description: Create a Maven project stub (a directory structure with pom.xml files) based on the structure and content of the application. This helps with locating the libraries and their versions, as well as adding the right Java EE API and creating the correct dependencies between the project modules.
